measured_by: single-option choice question ("If you get the chance, will you get vaccinated against Corona?")
justification: "Vaccination intention … was assessed with single-option choice ('Vaccines against the Corona virus are now available. If you get the chance, will you get vaccinated against Corona?': Definitely yes, probably yes, probably not, definitely not …)."

measured_by: four-item knowledge questionnaire on potential harms and uncertainty
justification: "Knowledge … was assessed …: four items on potential harms (e.g. headache …) and uncertainty (e.g. reduction of contagiousness)."
"Risk perception and fear (Study 3). Five items measured the fear of getting or spreading COVID-19," specifying the multi-item measure for the fear construct.

measured_by: normalized frequency format (out of 1,000 people estimate)
justification: "Respondents' estimates of how many people get sick with COVID-19 … were elicited … using a normalized frequency format (out of 1,000 people) to show understanding of vaccine efficacy," indicating this numeric frequency format was the tool to measure risk perception.

topic_or_construct: evaluation of COVID-19 vaccination benefit–harm ratio
justification: "Participants of all studies evaluated the benefit-harm ratio of COVID-19 vaccination … on an 11-point rating scale," identifying the scale used for this evaluative construct.
